Transcript:
Michelle: You ready? 
Michelle: I know. I know that. I guess I just keep thinking about getting 
caught and put in jail. 
Danny: It's not going to happen. 
Danny: So get your bag together, I'm going to get the vent. Hey, hey, get 
down. Get down. 
Michelle: What? What? 
Danny: It's a motion detector. Phillip or Aitoro, they know that this is 
the fastest route to the secure room and they put in a little extra protection. 
Michelle: You can just pop it off the wall. 
Danny: No, no, no, no, no, honey. If that thing see us, we're finished.
Gus: What the hell are you doing here? What are you doing here? 
Double Danny: Leave me alone, man. 
Giselle: What's your name? 
Double Danny: Hey, I'm just here to party, okay. 
Double Michelle: What's your problem, mister? 
Gus: As if you both didn't know. Excuse me. Excuse me. 
Olivia: 
So, when did you get here, cowboy? 
Josh: Just now. 
Olivia: Good. Well then let's mosey on over to the watering hole and get 
some champagne. 
Josh: Olivia, I caught the tail end of that conversation you were just 
having with Alan Spaulding. Now what exactly did he mean when he said I skated 
past those kickback charges, no thanks to you. 
Olivia: Well, when the picture hit the newspaper, the one of you bribing 
Vreeland. 
Josh: I didn't bribe anyone. 
Olivia: I know. That's the point. I knew that and I was powerless to help 
you. We all knew. That's what Alan meant. You skated past when the real picture 
of Chavez surfaced, proving you innocent. 
Josh: The real picture. 
Olivia: Yeah. 
Josh: I don't think that one's any more real than mine was. 

Ross: Ah, look at this. Isn't this some kind of welcome back party? 
Blake: Phillip really went all out. I'm sure Beth is overwhelmed. 
Ross: Oh, thank you. 
Blake: So, little red riding hood, don't you hide, I'm going to mingle.

Tory: Blake, I don't think this is such a good idea. Don't you have some 
briefs that I can file or something. 
Ross: (Laughing) don't be ridiculous, no. Hey, look, the way you look 
tonight, you are going to be the belle of the ball. Except for Myrna Loy, of 
course. 
Blake: Thank you, Mr. Powell. 
Ross: I can't get over how much you look like... Well suffice it to say 
that you look stunning. 
Tory: I wouldn't go that far. 
Blake: Number one rule: Just say thank you. 
Tory: Well, thank your wife. If anyone is to thank, it's her. 
Blake: Okay, I'll take it. Come on, red riding hood, we're going to make 
one of these wolves a future date. 
Rick: Honk your horn, Harpo. 
Harley: No. And don't you do it either. We're trying to be inconspicuous. 
Rick: Please. These costumes are a dead giveaway. People will know 
exactly who we are. Glad we're here? 
Harley: No. 
Rick: Let's go. 
Harley: No. 
Rick: With our luck, Phillip's going to be here dressed up like Darth 
Vader, he's going to zap us with a laser gun. 
Harley: Well, the important thing is that you are here for your friend 
Beth. She's alive, she's back and she's better than ever. And you couldn't miss 
that.

Rick: No, but you could. 
Harley: I could, but I'm a great friend. 
Rick: You're more than that. We're a team. 
Harley: 1:00, it's the Princess herself, waiting for her Prince charming. 
Why does this not surprise me? 
Lillian: Honey, one thing I know for 
sure is we have no Uncle George.

Phillip: Not that I know of. Let me see. "Dear Beth, so sorry I couldn't 
make it tonight. Joy and best wishes on your miraculous return. Love, Uncle 
George." Okay, who is Uncle George? 
Lorelei: Well, take a guess. Go on. 
Lillian: I couldn't possibly. 
Phillip: Neither can I. 
Lorelei: Oh, come on. You can do better than that. 
Phillip: I don't know who it is. 
Lillian: I don't either, honey. Is this a game? 
Edmund: You 
might want to watch where you're going. 
Waiter: I'm sorry, I didn't see you, sir. 
Edmund: You walked right into me. 
Lorelei: Oh, great, it's 
Edmund. I mean, this is typical. This is typical. 
Phillip: What are you doing here? 
Edmund: You know perfectly well why I'm here, Phillip. I have to be near 
Beth. 
Phillip: Please escort this gentlemen from the premises. 
Edmund: Is that your way of saying I'm not invited to your little party. 
Phillip: Very quick. Very quick, Edmund. If he returns, call the police. 
Security guard: Let's go. 
Edmund: I am perfectly capable of walking out of here on my own, thank 
you very much. 
Lillian: So now tell me who Uncle George is. 
Edmund: Did you say Uncle George? 
Lillian: Edmund, would you 
just please leave; this is none of your business. 
Edmund: It most certainly is my business, if it's about Uncle George. So 
he sent you a telegram, did he? The old duff, well I... Can I see it, please? 
Phillip: You know this person. 
Edmund: Well, I should say so, he's my dear mother's brother. Man of 
great courage in his own right as well. Yes, he turned his back on the crown and 
married a poor, starving misfit he met in a bar. Turned her into a lady to-- not 
that she was ever grateful. 
Lorelei: Well, how... how do you know? I mean, sometimes people have a 
hard time showing their true feelings. 
Edmund: Well, you remember the way she treated him at her wedding. 
Lorelei: She was just doing what she had to do, gosh... 
Edmund: Yes, and look what trouble it got her into too, you remember 
that. 
Phillip: This George person is a member of his family? 
Lorelei: Yes. Yes. And I was just about to tell you that before Edmund so 
rudely crashed my party. 
Phillip: Well, that's okay. I'm glad we got that all straightened out. 
Thank you, Edmund. Edmund can now go. 
Lorelei: Well, no, no, no. Not before I have a word with him. You have 
some nerve. 
Phillip: Well, I was just trying to point out how completely lost you are 
without me. 
Lorelei: I'm lost because you set me up. 
Edmund: I wasn't 
trying to trick you, I was just trying to show you how easy it is to get caught. 
Lorelei: Yeah, well show me again and I'll bust you one right in the 
snout. 
Edmund: Look at that, regressing to your street urchin ways already.

Lorelei: Watch it, Eddy. 
Edmund: You might want to keep your voice down, ducky. 
Lorelei: Okay, okay. Act like you're begging me. 
Edmund: Act is if I'm what? 
Lorelei: Pretend that your pleading, or I'm just going to yell grits 
right now. 
Edmund: Have you completely lost your mind? 
Lorelei: We've got to keep up appearances, remember? Okay, okay. It took 
me a while, but I finally realized I need you. 
Edmund: My God, Lorelei. 
Lorelei: Beg. I want to see some begging going. 
Edmund: You're taking me back? 
Blake: So is Rick on call? 
Harley: Yeah, he's on call with Meta every 15 seconds, checking on the 
baby. He's obsessed with the fatherhood thing. 
Blake: But is he good at changing a diaper? 
Harley: He can do it one- handed. 
Blake: You need this guy around all the time. 
Harley: Yeah, well, that's the thing that nobody's supposed to know, 
Blake, is that Rick and I have moved in together. 
Blake: (Gasps) oh, my God. When did this happen? 
Harley: Blake, Blake, we are just friends. 
Blake: For now. 
Harley: No, no, really. We are... We're pacing ourselves. We're taking it 
one step at a time. 
Blake: Honey, you had a baby with this man, you skipped a few steps along 
the way. 
Harley: Listen to me. Would it be better for Jude if we were actually 
married? Probably, yes. But that's not where we are. We're taking it one step at 
a time. We'll see what happens. 
Olivia: Why on earth would you 
question the validity of that photo, Josh? 
Josh: Mine was a fake, why not his? 
Olivia: He admitted to bribing Vreeland as well as a couple of other 
people. He went to prison. 
Josh: Yeah, that's what's strange about it. 
Olivia: What? That a guilty man went to prison? 
Josh: Look, I did some research on this guy, all right. I found his rap 
sheet on the internet. He has an arrest record half a mile long, no convictions, 
not once until now. He beat every rap until right now. Why is that? 
Olivia: Because he got caught red-handed, he confessed. 
Josh: Exactly. He didn't fight it. I think that's odd, don't you? 
Olivia: You know what? Maybe he just got tired of whittling out of 
things. Or maybe he negotiated a better deal for himself. 
Josh: Maybe. Or maybe he took the fall for someone else. 

Danny: Okay. Fine. 
Michelle: Okay? 
Danny: This will let us get through the duct without being noticed. Are 
you ready? 
Michelle: Yeah, let's get this over with. What's wrong? 
Danny: Well, we lost a lot of time. It took us nearly 30 minutes to get 
to this point. I was counting on ten, 15 tops. 
Gus: Sorry to wake you 
up there, Pally. Let's just say I got a tip there might be a breach in the 
security tonight. Can I have the keys, please? Hurry up. 
Michelle: 
Oh, my God, Danny.
Buzz: Hey. 
Clayton: Hey. 
Buzz: I thought cedars kept you residents locked up 24-7, no? 
Mel: Dad sprung me. 
Clayton: Kidnapped her is more like it. She'd rather work than eat, you 
know. But sometimes, once in a while, what I say goes. 
Mel: Once in a while? 
Clayton: You got a table in the back? 
Buzz: Yeah, right this way. Hey, guys, the usual? 
Clayton: Yeah, the usual's good. 
Buzz: Okay, so you won't need... 
Clayton: No, no, no, we don't need those. Did you want something else?

Mel: No. 
Clayton: No. Uh-oh, I have a feeling that I'm in trouble. Was it 
something I said, or what? 
Mel: Something you did, or rather didn't do. Mom told me about your 
reaction to Remy's birthday present. 
Clayton: You know, hold up, wait a minute. Wait one minute, now. I 
thought that those CDs that Remy made me were a collection of that hippity hop 
stuff that... 
Mel: Hip-hop, Dad. It's called hip-hop. 
Clayton: Yeah, hip-hop, bunny hop, hopscotch, you know what I'm talking 
about. What's the difference? The point is that when I found out that they were 
early jazz recordings I apologized. 
Mel: And did you thank him? 
Clayton: Yeah, yeah. I think so. Yeah. 
Mel: Well, then why did Remy go away angry? 
Clayton: Because he's always angry, Mel. Always angry. Everything I do 
for that kid just gets thrown right back in my face, you know that. 
Mel: Well, Dad, you need to just lighten up on him. Take a step back.

Clayton: Yeah, what? So he'll wind up on the street, picking his guitar 
for spare change. Your Uncle Albert, right, he wanted to be a horn blower, 
right? Where is now? Blowing that trumpet for the Salvation Army. 
Mel: Uncle Albert is a dentist. 
Clayton: Sure on the weekdays. 
Mel: Dad, come on. Remy loves you. He worships you. But no matter what he 
does, it's never good enough. 
Clayton: Honey, I love you and your brother more than life itself. But 
with Remy, I just have to work harder than I did with you, that's all. And he'll 
come around, don't worry about it. 
Mel: Do you ever think that it might be you who needs to come around?

Clayton: I never accepted less from you, and I'm certainly not going to 
start with your brother. Now, did you want fries with that burger? 

Buzz: Gee, Frank, go ahead, have this. Looks like you need it. What's wrong? 
Frank: It's Marina, Dad. 
Buzz: What, is she sick? 
Frank: No, she got suspended from school. 
Buzz: When did this happen? 
Frank: A couple weeks ago. 
Buzz: Eleni called you? 
Frank: No, no. That would've been a civil thing to do. She actually sent 
me an email. 
Buzz: An email? 
Frank: Yeah, that's the way Eleni communicates with me now, over the 
computer. Sort of her new way of keeping me out of their lives. 

Olivia: Look, who cares that Chavez took the fall. What's important is that you 
were cleared and so was the harbor project. Why worry about anything else? 
Josh: Because maybe the criminal who did this is still out there on the 
street somewhere. 
Olivia: So what if he is? What does that have to do with us? 
Josh: Olivia, this guy, Chavez, this was not some basic lowlife criminal. 
All right? This guy's at the top of the food chain. You start thinking about who 
he might cover for, and you get a list of pretty-high-up-there names, like 
Sandoval, Machado or Santos. 
Olivia: You can't think that Danny Santos had anything to do with this.

Josh: Not Danny. Tony. 
Olivia: Tony? 
Josh: Maybe he had some kind of agenda when he came to work for us at 
Lewis construction. 
Olivia: Yes, he had an agenda. He was in love with your daughter. We both 
know why he took that job. 
Josh: Do we? 
Olivia: Yes. He took the job for one reason, to prove something to Marah. 
And I can't believe that he would use that to get her father into trouble. 
Josh: Well, maybe... Depending on what was important to him, what was 
most important, Marah, or his place in the family. 
Olivia: Come on. 
Josh: What? 
Olivia: You are walking down a very dangerous route if you continue to 
pursue this, Josh. I mean, if Chavez was covering for someone in the family, 
they're not going to be happy that you're asking all these questions. 
Josh: To hell with them. 
Olivia: These are not the kind of people you want to cross. Listen to me. 
Just forget about this. Okay? You don't have to be the hero every single time. 
Just drop this before you endanger yourself and your family, because these 
people will stop at nothing to protect their interests, okay? Nothing. 
Josh: You know, you seem to know an awful lot about "these people." 
Blake: What? Now? Well, can't it wait? All right, all right. 15, 20 
minutes. All right. Bye. 
Ross: 15, 20 minutes, you have to be where? 
Blake: Oh, honey, that was my producer, Ron. And apparently the director 
is coming into town tonight, he wants to take a meeting with me. He has all 
sorts of notes to give me about translating this book into a movie. And he wants 
to meet with me tonight. 
Ross: Oh, for heaven's sakes, it can wait until tomorrow? 
Blake: No, he's taking a 6:00 A.M. Flight to L.A. It's now or never, 
honey, I'm sorry. I am, but... This is business. I have to go, do you mind? 
Ross: Blake, what you're talking about is a movie. This is s a welcome 
back party for someone everybody thought was dead. Now I know you weren't the 
best of friends with Beth... 
Blake: I realize that, Ross, I have no choice here, this is my first 
screenplay, I am powerless. If the director says jump, I jump. It should only 
take a couple of hours. But it might be late, so I probably should meet you at 
the house. I'm sorry. Will you please tell Beth that... Tell her I'm happy for 
her. Bye. 
Guard: Wrong one. I could've sworn... 
Gus: Come on. Come on. Just give me the keys, will you? (Alarm beeps ) I 
thought you turned the alarm off for this door. 
Guard: I did. Must be going off somewhere else. 
Gus: Come on, let's go. 
Danny: All right, I think they're 
gone. 
Michelle: What about the alarm? 
Danny: Come on. Get yourself together; we've got to get out of here. 
We've got 60 seconds. 
Michelle: 60 seconds, Danny. 
Lorelei: Don't put words in my 
mouth. 
Edmund: But you said you needed me. 
Lorelei: Don't you get it, Beth just broke up with you. If she goes back 
to you now, people are going to get suspicious. You've got to act like you're 
losing this argument, and don't you try to sweet talk me, because it ain't going 
to work. 
Edmund: Isn't, Lorelei. Isn't. 
Lorelei: Yeah? Well, if we're teaming up again, it isn't for public 
consumption, right? 
Edmund: You're saying we're a team again? 
Lorelei: Of course, we are. 
Edmund: But I didn't know what to think, I thought you thought the worst 
about me. I was trying to kill Beth and steal her silver mine and put her 
children in some workhouse orphanage. I don't know what I was thinking. 
Lorelei: Ah, Eddy. I know you're better than that. Besides, I know 
Phillip hates your guts, so I take everything he says with a grain of salt. Who 
else treats me the way you do? 
Edmund: Nobody. 
Lorelei: And you go get me the barbecue every time I get a hankering. And 
you get me those chocolate- covered cream things whenever I get hungry. 
Edmund: You're always hungry. 
Lorelei: Okay, I know that. That's the point. I can't let Phillip or 
Lillian know that. You're the only person who lets me be me; you're the only 
break I get. 
Edmund: I'm glad you finally realized that. 
Lorelei: Yeah, I realized it. I realized something else too. There's 
bigger fish to fry than Beth's estate. 
Edmund: Meaning? 
Lorelei: Phillip. He's so la-la Beth's back, we can get anything we want 
out of him. 
Edmund: Brilliant. Absolutely brilliant. 
Lorelei: I don't see too much begging going on here. 
Edmund: Oh, yes. Please, please, please. So what's the plan? 
Lorelei: Well, I was figuring you could help me come up with that. But we 
can't do it tonight. So are you with me or aren't you? 
Edmund: Do you really have to ask? 
Lorelei: Okay. But get ready because I'm going to throw you out of here. 
Get out and stay out. 
Edmund: Beth, Beth, please. 
Lorelei: If you don't walk out that door right now, I'm going to call 
security. Call me. 
Edmund: Will you listen. I don't know how you can do this to me after all 
I've done for you! 
Lorelei: Done for me? Done for me? I should have you thrown in jail or 
out of the country. But for now just get out. 
Buzz: Frank, you know, 
hearing through the email that your daughter's been suspended from school is 
bad, but it could be worse. What happened? 
Frank: She was caught smoking in school. And it wasn't the first time. 
The first time they caught her, they gave her a warning. But the second time, 
she mouthed off to some teacher and then they booted her out. 
Buzz: Poor Marina. The worst thing she ever did that I remember was 
leaving her toys at the Booson Diner, customers kept sitting on them. 
Frank: She's onto bigger things now, that's what concerns me. 
Buzz: So what's next, you're going to fly out and... 
Frank: I wanted to do that already, Dad, but Eleni said, you know what, 
you're just going to make things worse. 
Buzz: How could things be any worse than they are? 
Frank: That was my point, that's exactly what I said. I was on the phone 
with her, we got into an argument, she hung up. I didn't even get a chance to 
talk to Marina. All I wanted to tell her was... I'm just being a good dad. I'm 
just being a good father. You know what she told me? You know what Eleni told 
me? You don't want to hear what she told me. 
Buzz: Look, I'll fly out. I'll do whatever you want me to do. 
Frank: Oh, forget it, Dad. 
Buzz: No, come on, let me help. Eleni and I do get along. And maybe it's 
better that you don't see each other now you've got some unfinished business.

Frank: I know you mean well, but that's not the solution. 
Buzz: Well, then what is? 
Frank: I've got to bring my daughter back home; I've got to bring her 
back to Springfield. God knows what she's getting into out there. I want my 
daughter back home. 
Ross: Tory, I want to introduce you to Phillip 
and Beth, and I think I should explain to them where Blake went to, all right? 
Tory: Oh. 
Ross: You all right? 
Tory: Yeah, I'm fine. I'm just a little dizzy. 
Ross: Can I get you anything? 
Tory: No. But you know, I think I need to just go home, but I left my car 
at your place, so I'll just call a cab. 
Ross: Don't be silly. I'll drive you. 
Tory: What about the party? 
Ross: Don't worry about the party. I will call Phillip tomorrow and I 
will explain everything. Let's get you out of here. 
Olivia: You know, 
all I know about these people is what I've heard. And if what I've heard is 
true, then you need to let go of this picture. Then what if... What if Felix 
Chavez was covering for someone and you expose them? 
Josh: They go to jail. 
Olivia: Before or after they come after you and your kids. Just think 
about this, okay? Is it worth it? These people have a way of stopping questions 
that they don't want asked. And if you are onto something, then we're all going 
to be in trouble, Josh. 
Josh: Okay. Okay. You've made your point. 
Olivia: Just leave it alone, okay. Just forget about it. We should be 
celebrating, not playing detective. 
Josh: You are right. 
Olivia: You know what? I'm going to go and get us champagne and then we 
go have some fun, okay? 
Josh: All right. 
Lorelei: Rick, it is so good to see you. And 
you too, Harley. 
Harley: I'm really glad that you're okay, Beth. 
Rick: Yeah, when we thought you were gone... Well, I guess you realized 
that you missed your own funeral. 
Lorelei: Well, you know me, always late for everything. 
Rick: No, I've never known you to be late for anything in your life 
actually. 
Lorelei: Oh. Then it's about time I started. (Laughing) what? 
Rick: It's nothing. You just seem really, really happy, I guess. 
Lorelei: And what's wrong with that? 
Rick: Nothing. Absolutely nothing. It's... So I understand that 
congratulations are in order. You dumped the loser Prince, Edmund. 
Lorelei: Would you excuse me? I need to say hello to somebody over there. 
Rick: Does she seem a little different to you? 
Harley: Oh, I don't know. But if you want to see the same old Beth, tell 
her we've moved in together. 
Rick: We're worried about Phillip's reaction, actually. 
Harley: Hey, I was thinking, maybe we should've come as defensive 
linemen. Little extra padding. 
Rick: Yeah, right. Right. 
Harley: There's always tomorrow. 
Rick: No, no, no. We did that last time. It blew up in our face, 
remember? Now this time it's straight out with it. 
Harley: But not tonight, Rick. 
Rick: If the subject comes up... 
Harley: How is the subject going to come up? We're at a party. 
Rick: I'm not looking forward to telling Phillip that we're living 
together even more than you are, but if the moment presents itself then... 
Phillip: Looks like the moment just did. 
Rick: Hey. 
Phillip: Hey. 
Rick: Hey. Hi. 
Phillip: It's okay. Not to worry. Actually, I think the time to worrying 
about timing has come and gone for all of us. Oh, but just for the record, I am 
not angry or jealous or anything about whatever it is that you two are doing 
together, so just relax, enjoy the party. Excuse me. 
Rick: Excuse me. So you're telling me that you're not upset. 
Phillip: I'm not upset. Rick, I'm just trying to speed things along here. 
You know, the two of you are sitting around agonizing about when to tell me 
something that I couldn't care less about. Stop wasting time, get on with your 
life. I have. 
Gus: Told you we should've split up. Just give me the 
keys, please. Hurry up. Wait a second. We got them. 
Guard: What? 
Gus: Look out for me. Get my back. Damn it. I know they were here. I 
know. I can practically smell them. 
Buzz: So dessert? 
Clayton: Oh, no, no, no. If I was ten years younger, maybe. You know, 
Buzz does not seem like himself. I wonder if everything's all right. 
Mel: No changing the subject. We were talking about Remy. 
Clayton: Ah, Remy. All right. 
Buzz: You're right. 
Frank: About what, pop? 
Buzz: Marina should be home here. Whatever we have to do, let's do it.

Frank: Thanks, pop. It's nice having somebody on my side. 
Mel: You're a great father and I love you to death, but you've got to let 
Remy find his own way. 
Clayton: Remy, Remy, can we talk about someone else, please? 
Mel: As long as it's not me. 
Clayton: When was the last time you were out on a date, huh? 
Mel: Oh, Dad. When was the last time you forgot to ask that question? 
Look, I'm not exactly an old maid yet. 
Clayton: I don't know, you're getting there now. 
Mel: Getting there? Dad. 
Rick: This way, Harpo, this way. There you go. (Toots horn) 
Clayton: Now that is a good- looking couple. Look at that right there. 
They look happy together. Hey, hey, Groucho! 
Rick: Hey, Clayton. Want to meet Harpo? 
Clayton: Harpo, huh? You must be Harley. My daughter has told me so much 
about that little boy of yours. 
Harley: Your daughter? 
Rick: This is Mel Boudreaux, actually Dr. Mel Boudreaux. She's the one... 
Harley: Oh, who's covering Rick's rounds. Thank you. I don't know how to 
thank you enough. 
Mel: Oh, no. I should be thanking you. I'm learning a lot. 
Clayton: So how you guys working this? You trading that little guy back 
and forth or what? 
Rick: I only get him when he's wet? 
Clayton: You page him on your beeper, huh? 
Harley: No, actually, well, it's an unusual arrangement, but we've moved 
in together. It makes the most sense. 
Clayton: Well, that's great. I mean, you know, nothing better for a child 
than a two-parent family, huh? 
Harley: I agree. 
Mel: You know what? I've got to get back to work. I was supposed to be at 
the hospital ten minutes ago. 
Clayton: Wait a minute. I thought you said you had an hour? 
Mel: No, you lost track of time, Dad. Thanks for dinner. Bye. 
Clayton: All right, see you later now. Now, I know you've got some 
pictures for me to see. 
Harley: Well, I just so happen to have some. 
Clayton: Look at that. 
Harley: Isn't he cute? 
Rick: Mel, wait. 
Tory: Ross, I'm fine. I just... I had a little too much champagne, that's 
all. 
Ross: Which is why you are not driving, you're not doing anything. You're 
going to stay here tonight. 
Tory: No, I want to go home. I need to go home. 
Ross: Tory, what's the matter with you? Could it be the flu or is it 
because you're not wearing your glasses? 
Tory: No, I'm fine. No, Ross, I'm fine! It was a year ago tomorrow. I 
thought that if I went to this party with you and Blake that I would forget, but 
I don't think that I'll ever forget. 
Ross: Your husband? 
Tory: God, we had so much to celebrate, you know. He just passed the bar, 
he just won his first big case. We were going to have this great, big family, 
you know, just like you and Blake. I remember sitting next to hospital bed, and 
he opened eyes and he looked right up at me, but he couldn't move or speak. They 
told me that he had been hit by a drunk driver and that his condition was 
critical, but I didn't believe them. I just couldn't. So I just took his hand 
and I told him it was going to be okay, that he was going to be okay. Not how 
much I loved him, just that he was going to be okay. And then he closed his eyes 
and he died before I got a chance to tell him how much I loved him. 
Ross: Tory, he knew how much you loved him, I'm sure of that. 
Tory: God, look at me in this stupid dress. Who was I trying to kid, 
thinking if I got some stupid makeover and went to a party that it was going to 
change my life? I think about him every single day, Ross. I miss him every 
single day. 
Ross: Sit down for a moment. Now listen to me. If your husband can see 
you-- and I firmly believe that in some way, he can-- he's very proud of you. 
Following in his footsteps and doing so wonderfully well in law school. You've 
taken control of your life and your husband is now cheering you on. Tory, you 
are a strong and Beautiful, young woman, you really are. 
Tory: I just want him back. Ross, I just want him back. (Sobbing) 
Danny: Okay, all right. So we didn't pull off the heist tonight, Mr. Big 
is going to have to deal. My immediate problem is Aitoro. I'm obviously going to 
have to rethink the mechanics of the break-in. 
Michelle: (Clears throat) Danny. 
Danny: Snake, he's 
everywhere. Everywhere we look. 
Michelle: Mm-hmm. And the snake is right there, coming in the door. 
Gus: Oh, sorry. Excuse me. Hey, you two, are you enjoying your evening. 
Michelle: Yeah, we're having a wonderful time. 
Gus: Apparently. I haven't seen you around for a little while. Except, of 
course, I did see another couple with identical costumes as yours. It was very 
interesting. 
Man: You mean us? (Laughter) 
Danny: Gus Aitoro, why don't you mean Bob and Jessica Batemen. Bob was 
one of the contractors for the secure room. 
Jessica: We knew how they were going to dress, so we decided to rent the 
same costumes as a joke. 
Gus: Funny, did a good job. 
Bob: We had you fooled, right? 
Gus: Yeah. 
Bob: Catch you later? 
Jessica: Bye. 
Gus: You know what they say. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, 
and somebody's going to jail.
Rick: What's going on? Do you always 
desert your father like that? 
Mel: No, I just didn't realize how late it was. 
Rick: Well, listen. Listen, I want to talk you about what happened. 
Mel: I don't understand. 
Rick: In Harley's living room. I kissed you and... 
Mel: No, forget about it. Ship's passing in the night. It didn't mean 
anything, and I certainly didn't expect you to call me. Believe me, I know how 
it is and I think it's really good that you are moving back in with Harley for 
Jude and all. 
Rick: Well, I'm just trying to be a good father to my son, and you 
understand that. 
Mel: And now you'll be seeing him every day. I think that's great, Rick. 
I really do. But I'm late, so some other time. 
Harley: Rick? 
Rick: Yeah. 
Harley: Hey. Are you okay? 
Rick: Yeah, fine. I'm just hungry. I'm going to go inside and get 
something to eat. 
Harley: All right. 
Phillip: There you are. I've been looking 
all over for you. 
Lorelei: Yeah, well, I was just recovering from Edmund. 
Phillip: What are talking about? Looks like you gave him hell to me. 
Which was good, very good. I was actually a little surprised after the way you 
had defended him earlier. 
Lorelei: Well, you know, old feelings die hard. And I was married to him 
at one point, so... And you know, even bad people can do good things sometimes. 
Phillip: That's true, they can. Although I do think there are exceptions 
to that rule. 
Lorelei: Whatever Beth felt for Edmund died in Mexico. 
Phillip: You're referring to yourself in the third person now? You said, 
"whatever Beth..." It's okay. It's okay. You know what? I'm sure after 
everything that you went through, you probably do feel like a different person.

Lorelei: You're right. You're right. I do. 
Phillip: You know what? The important thing, though, is to remember that 
Edmund is not a different person, and you are much better off without him. 
Lorelei: Right again. 
Phillip: And you know what? Give yourself a break. You've been through a 
hell of a tough time. But you're stronger now. I can see it. You're much 
stronger. Somebody gives you a hard time, you give it right back. 
Lorelei: And don't you forget it. 
Phillip: I won't. I won't. And I like it. I do. I like this new strength 
that I see in you. 
Lorelei: Yeah? I'm so glad to hear you say that.

Danny: So where'd you leave your sense of humor, 
back in Chicago with your real name? 
Gus: I lost my sense of humor the day your father killed mine. 
Michelle: That wasn't Danny's fault, Gus. Why do you keep trying to make 
it all about him? 
Gus: I got a phone call from Spaulding security tonight. Apparently 
somebody tried to break in. 
Danny: Really? 
Gus: Mm-hmm. 
Danny: Maybe I should head over there. 
Gus: No, it's all right. Whoever was there is gone now. 
Danny: Do you know if anything was taken? 
Gus: Taken? Not yet. 
Danny: I'll have to read the report tomorrow. 
Gus: Yeah, you do that. Catch you later. 
Michelle: God, that was close. 
Danny: All right, somehow we've got to deal with him and steal that $25 
million by tomorrow or we're dead. 
Michelle: We can do it, Danny. We got past Gus once, right? 
Danny: I just don't know if we can do it again.
